message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.SD 

This paper deals with computational methods for identifying sarcasm in text, which is a problem that falls under the subfield of natural language processing (NLP). Specifically, the paper focuses on identifying the target of sarcasm in a sentence, which involves both syntactic and semantic analysis. This problem is relevant to several sub-categories of CS, including computational linguistics (cs.CL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), machine learning (cs.LG), information retrieval (cs.IR), and software development (cs.SD). The use of statistical classifiers and rule-based extractors also suggests a focus on data-driven approaches, which is a common theme in many of these subfields.
